channel.title: Change The Window Name In IE
channel.description:
This tutorial will teach how to make a basic change in the registery to achive the below. [img]http://img530.imageshack.us/img530/8598/ie16fx.jpg[/img]
1. Click on the [b]Start Menu[/b] > [b]Run...[/b]
2. Type in [i]Regedit[/i]
3. You should now see this screen. [img]http://img137.imageshack.us/img137/6319/ie22tx.jpg[/img]
4. Click on the + beside [b]HKEY_CURRENT_USER[/b] > [b]Software[/b] > [b]Microsoft[/b] > [b]Internet Explorer[/b]. The click on [b]main[/b], not the plus. It should look like this... [img]http://img147.imageshack.us/img147/4307/ie31ju.jpg[/img]
5. Have a look at the list and see if there is a value called [i]Window Title[/i]. If so double click on it and change it to what you want your Title to be. Otherwise move on to step 6.
6. Click on [b]Edit[/b] > [b]New[/b] > [b]String Value[/b]. Name it [i]Window Title[/i], double click on it and change the Value Data to whatever you want the title to be.
7. Open up Internet Explorer and see the change.
Credits to winguides.com, for giving me the idea to write this tutorial.

item.title: Change The Window Name In IE
item.dc:creator: @alowaniak alowaniak
item.description:
@alowaniak wrote:

bootnecklad:

MMMMM… i would like it if i used I.E, but i use firefox… i’ve finally come out of that boggy MUD

its verry easy in firefox actually just type in the URL javascript: void(document.title=“Window name here”) it worked with me it only didn’t work in IE

Read full topic
item.source: Change The Window Name In IE

item.title: Change The Window Name In IE
item.dc:creator: @SamTheSam SamTheSam
item.description:
@SamTheSam wrote:

This tutorial will teach how to make a basic change in the registery to achive the below.

Click on the Start Menu > Run…

Type in Regedit

You should now see this screen.

Click on the + beside HKEY_CURRENT_USER > Software > Microsoft > Internet Explorer. The click on main, not the plus. It should look like this…

Have a look at the list and see if there is a value called Window Title. If so double click on it and change it to what you want your Title to be. Otherwise move on to step 6.

Click on Edit > New > String Value.
Name it Window Title, double click on it and change the Value Data to whatever you want the title to be.

Open up Internet Explorer and see the change.

Credits to winguides.com, for giving me the idea to write this tutorial.

Read full topic
item.source: Change The Window Name In IE
